comments.author: wlachance@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
Currently, for example, this document renders incorrectly:

https://docs.telemetry.mozilla.org/datasets/search/search_clients_daily/reference.html

This seems to be due to the fact that a sub-document included in the main reference specifies a weird hierarchy:

```md
# Introduction

...

#### Contents

...
```

https://github.com/mozilla/firefox-data-docs/blob/e03163a8ea58393f1f023f0dcab99e8ee26e1dfc/src/datasets/search/search_clients_daily/intro.md
https://github.com/mozilla/firefox-data-docs/blob/e03163a8ea58393f1f023f0dcab99e8ee26e1dfc/src/datasets/search/search_clients_daily/reference.md

This is arguably a problem with the markdown (which I'm about to fix) but it would be nice if this was handled a bit more gracefully by the toc parser if possible.

Currently, for example, this document renders incorrectly:

https://docs.telemetry.mozilla.org/datasets/search/search_clients_daily/reference.html

This seems to be due to the fact that a sub-document included in the main reference specifies a weird hierarchy:

```md
# Introduction

...

#### Contents

...
```

https://github.com/mozilla/firefox-data-docs/blob/e03163a8ea58393f1f023f0dcab99e8ee26e1dfc/src/datasets/search/search_clients_daily/intro.md
https://github.com/mozilla/firefox-data-docs/blob/e03163a8ea58393f1f023f0dcab99e8ee26e1dfc/src/datasets/search/search_clients_daily/reference.md

This is arguably a problem with the markdown (which I'm about to fix) but it would be nice if this was handled a bit more gracefully by the toc parser if possible.
comments.creator: wlachance@mozilla.com

comments.author: jrediger@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Ah yes, I stumbled upon this last week, just failed to file a bug.
This seems to always be due to an update to the underlying markdown parser, which suddenly started to escape nested headlines if they were not increasing 1-by-1. Surprsingly hard to find what the right way there would be, but I might have an idea now.
comments.creator: jrediger@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
Ah yes, I stumbled upon this last week, just failed to file a bug.
This seems to always be due to an update to the underlying markdown parser, which suddenly started to escape nested headlines if they were not increasing 1-by-1. Surprsingly hard to find what the right way there would be, but I might have an idea now.

Found a fix, found another bug in the underlying parser, which I now also fixed upstream.
Waiting for that before I can push a new release.
comments.creator: jrediger@mozilla.com

comments.author: jrediger@mozilla.com

Parser was fixed.
mdbook-dtmo updated, next deploy will pick up the fixed version.
